text:
United Airlines Named Best North American Airline for 15th Consecutive Year
United Airlines has been named “Best North American Airline” at the 2015 Business Traveller Asia-Pacific Travel Awards. It is the 15th year in a row that the carrier has received the accolade, which is based on voting by readers of the magazine.
Walter Dias, United’s managing director, Greater China and Korea Sales, was presented with the award at a ceremony at the Conrad Hong Kong Hotel attended by more than 350 senior executives representing hotels, airlines, airports and tourism boards.
“We are very excited to win this prestigious award for the 15th consecutive year,” said Dias. “It is further recognition from our customers in the region of the hard work of our employees in providing them with best-in-class and friendly service both on the ground and in the air. We will continue to strive to provide outstanding service to our customers here in Asia-Pacific and around the world.”
The Business Traveller Asia-Pacific Travel Awards are among the most prestigious in the Asia-Pacific travel industry. Organized by regional magazine “Business Traveller Asia-Pacific”, the awards are based on the results of a poll of the magazine’s subscribers, who include some of the region’s most frequent travelers. The poll was conducted between April and June this year and the results were compiled by independent marketing research company Ipsos.
United in Asia-Pacific
United operates nearly 320 weekly flights across the Pacific and within Asia-Pacific, serving 28 cities in 13 countries. Specifically, United operates nearly 200 weekly flights across the Pacific from 12 cities in the region to Honolulu and to its hubs in Chicago, Denver, Houston, Los Angeles, New York/Newark Liberty, San Francisco, and Washington D.C., with onward connections to more than 300 cities throughout the Americas. United also operates nearly 120 weekly flights within Asia-Pacific.
